profile.name: Parthkumar Patel
profile.title: Software Developer | Full-Stack Engineer
profile.summary: MS Computer Science student at Stevens Institute of Technology (3.9 GPA) with hands-on experience in full-stack development. Proficient in React, TypeScript, Node.js, and cloud deployment. Passionate about building scalable, user-centric web applications with modern technologies.

about.bio: Currently pursuing my MS in Computer Science at Stevens Institute of Technology with a 3.9 GPA, I bring practical experience in full-stack web development from internships at EventEase and TechBilv Solutions. I specialize in React, TypeScript, and modern web technologies, with hands-on experience in AWS deployment, REST API integration, and building responsive UI components from Figma designs. My academic projects include developing a Mini Search Engine using advanced algorithms. I thrive on solving complex problems with clean, efficient code and enjoy collaborating with teams to deliver high-quality solutions.

details: Focus on advanced computer science topics and research

bullets: Developed full-stack web applications using React.js, Vite, and Tailwind CSS, converting Figma designs into responsive and reusable UI components
Integrated dynamic data using REST APIs provided through Swagger JSON, ensuring accurate rendering and state synchronization
Built a full Admin/Dashboard application from scratch using React, TypeScript, ShadCN UI, and Redux Toolkit for global state management
Followed professional Git workflows including branching, merging, code reviews, and conflict resolution
Assisted with deployment, production builds, and hosting activities while gaining experience with AI-assisted development tools
Contributed to client-facing web applications using React.js, redesigning modals, enhancing layouts, and improving navigation elements
Integrated AI chatbot (Hoori), updated link structures, and implemented alphabetical scrolling for streamlined user experience
Managed production deployments using Visual Studio 2022, publishing builds and updating projects on AWS-connected IIS hosting servers
Hosted and configured static websites on AWS S3, gaining hands-on experience with cloud hosting and deployment pipelines
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to ensure timely delivery and alignment with client requirements

projects.name: Portfolio Website
projects.description: Fully responsive portfolio website built with React and TypeScript, featuring reusable components, dark/light mode toggle, and a modern UI. Implemented React Router for seamless navigation and managed all site content using JSON-driven data structures.

projects.name: Mini Search Engine
projects.description: Advanced search engine developed for CS 600 Advanced Algorithms course. Implements indexing, tokenization, ranking algorithms, and optimized search retrieval. Utilizes algorithmic techniques to improve query performance and handle large text datasets efficiently.

projects.name: Online Shop E-commerce Website
projects.description: Functional e-commerce platform with intuitive UI and responsive design. Features MVC backend architecture with user authentication, product management, and shopping cart functionality using MongoDB for data persistence.

projects.name: Heart Disease Prediction System
projects.description: Medical prediction system using machine learning to predict heart disease presence in patients. Analyzed 1,889 patient records with 14 medical features, achieving 87.83% accuracy with Artificial Neural Network. Implemented and compared 3 ML algorithms (KNN, Random Forest, ANN) for MIS-637 Data Analytics course.
highlights: Compared 3 ML algorithms (KNN, Random Forest, ANN)

projects.name: Credit Score Prediction System
projects.description: Machine learning system that predicts credit scores (Poor, Standard, Good) for 100,000 customers using 6 ML algorithms. Achieved 81% accuracy with Random Forest after handling class imbalance using SMOTE. Performed comprehensive data cleaning, feature engineering, and model comparison for CS-513 Knowledge Discovery course.
highlights: Compared 6 ML algorithms (KNN, Naive Bayes, Logistic Regression, Decision Tree, Random Forest, ANN)

projects.name: Tic-Tac-Toe Game
projects.description: Interactive browser-based game with advanced JavaScript features including AI opponent, move history, and responsive design. Demonstrates mastery of DOM manipulation and event handling.

certifications.name: 100 Days Of Code - 2024 Web Development Bootcamp

extracurricular.name: Co-Founder/Event Head
extracurricular.summary: Coordinated logistics for 30+ events, including venue selection, scheduling, setup, and on-site operations. Collaborated with vendors, speakers, and participants to ensure seamless execution and issue resolution.

extracurricular.name: Core Team Member
extracurricular.summary: Key team member at GEC Gandhinagar, organizing Garba festivals, cultural events, day celebrations, and freshers' parties. Managed documentation, sponsorships, permissions, and coordination to ensure seamless events and attendee satisfaction.
